result.execSummary:
The defendant Detra R Dukes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Straight time (without work release) to commence FORTHWITH.  Defendant may have Huber with standard release conditions on 4/08/2016 at 5:00 p.m.  Sentence Credit for 13 days were granted.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Detra R Dukes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by the defense in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Detra R Dukes in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
200 Days Jail, without work release until 5:00 pm on 4/8/2016, defendant may have HUBER with Standard Release Conditions at that time.   (Credit - 13 days).  Sentence commences immediately.
COSTS:  $253.00 Bail to be applied.
dated March 17, 2016   Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff. (to be addressed at status)
